com.github.dm.jrt.android.v11.method

Class LoaderRoutineMethod

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.dm.jrt.method.RoutineMethod
      • com.github.dm.jrt.android.v11.method.LoaderRoutineMethod
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.github.dm.jrt.android.core.config.LoaderConfigurable<LoaderRoutineMethod>, com.github.dm.jrt.android.core.config.LoaderConfiguration.Configurable<LoaderRoutineMethod>, com.github.dm.jrt.core.config.InvocationConfigurable<com.github.dm.jrt.method.RoutineMethod>, com.github.dm.jrt.core.config.InvocationConfiguration.Configurable<com.github.dm.jrt.method.RoutineMethod>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    LoaderRoutineMethod.ReflectionLoaderRoutineMethod

    public class LoaderRoutineMethod
extends com.github.dm.jrt.method.RoutineMethod
implements com.github.dm.jrt.android.core.config.LoaderConfigurable<LoaderRoutineMethod>
    This class provides an easy way to implement a routine running in dedicated Android Loaders, which can be combined in complex ways with other ones.

    How to implement a routine

    The class behaves like a RoutineMethod with a few differences. In order to avoid undesired leaks, the implementing class must be static. Moreover, each constructor must have the Loader context as first argument.
    Note that, for the method to be executed inside the Loader, all the input channels must be closed.

    How to access the Android Context

    It is possible to get access to the Android Context (that is the application instance) from inside the routine by calling the getContext() method.

    Like, for instance: 

    
 public static class MyMethod extends LoaderRoutineMethod {

   public MyMethod(final LoaderContext context) {
     super(context);
   }

   void run(@Input final Channel<?, String> input,
       @Output final Channel<String, ?> output) {
     final MyApplication application = (MyApplication) getContext();
     // do it
   }
 }

    See LoaderRoutineMethodCompat for support of API levels lower than 11.

    Created by davide-maestroni on 08/19/2016.

      • call

        @NotNull
public <OUT> com.github.dm.jrt.core.channel.Channel<?,OUT> call(@Nullable
                                                                         Object... params)
        Calls the routine.
        The output channel will produced the data returned by the method. In case the method does not return any output, the channel will be anyway notified of invocation abortion and completion.

        Note that the specific method will be selected based on the specified parameters. If no matching method is found, the call will fail with an exception.

        Overrides:
        call in class com.github.dm.jrt.method.RoutineMethod
        Type Parameters:
        OUT - the output data type.
        Parameters:
        params - the parameters.
        Returns:
        the output channel instance.

      • callParallel

        @NotNull
public <OUT> com.github.dm.jrt.core.channel.Channel<?,OUT> callParallel(@Nullable
                                                                                 Object... params)
        Calls the routine in parallel mode.
        The output channel will produced the data returned by the method. In case the method does not return any output, the channel will be anyway notified of invocation abortion and completion.

        Note that the specific method will be selected based on the specified parameters. If no matching method is found, the call will fail with an exception.

        Overrides:
